titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James Alvey, Sr., Judgment
CWG10520

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Grayson Circuit Court Sct.
May 14th May Term 1861
Commonwealth Plff
against } Indictment for Keeping Tipling House
James Alvey Sr. Deft

This day came the attorney for the commonwealth and the Deft filed plea of Not Guilty and thereupon came a Jury Thomas P. Jones, Thomas Conklin, B. O. Fulkerson Jno A Wooldridge Jack Ferry, Byram Hart, A. H. Rice, A. S. Mercer, R B Day, Felix Wilson William Grayson Wm Crawford, who were sworn to try the issue Joined, who Returned the following verdict towit, We of the Jury find the Defendant, Guilty of Keeping a Tipling house
It is therefore adjudged by the Court that Commonwealth Recover against the Defendant, the Sum of sixty Dollars for Said offence, also her costs herein Expended & may have Execution &'

A Copy Attest
Edwin Thomas clk
Grayson Circuit Court

No 88 Com
Commonwealth
vs } Copy Judgment
James Alvey Sr
